niagara.utils
Class TuplePage

java.lang.Object
  niagara.utils.TuplePage

public class TuplePage
extends java.lang.Object

A TuplePage is (surprise) a page of tuple objects. TuplePages are the unit of transfer between operators. Tuple pages contain an array of tuple objects as well as flags such as shutdown, get partial results and so on. Note this is a buffer, not a queue, interleaving calls to get and put is not recommended.

Version:
1.0

Constructor Detail

TuplePage

public TuplePage()
Pages are always a fixed size.

TuplePage

private TuplePage(boolean empty)
This constructor creates an empty page to be used for control elements going down stream. It will only be called from createControlPage function.

Method Detail

                                          java.lang.String ctrlMsgStr)

setCtrlMsg

getCtrlMsg

public java.lang.String getCtrlMsg()

startPutMode

public void startPutMode()
Sets the currentPosition pointer appropriately, must be called before putting any tuples in the page

put

public void put(Tuple tuple)
Put a tuple in the page. Throws an exception if the buffer is full. Note, this is a buffer not a queue. Calls to put and get should NOT be interleaved. A sequence of put calls should be used to fill the page, a sequence of get calls can then be used to read from the page.

startGetMode

public void startGetMode()
Sets the currentPosition pointer appropriately, must be called before getting any tuples from the page

get

public Tuple get()
Get a tuple from the page. Throws an exception if the buffer is empty. Note, this is a buffer not a queue. Calls to put and get should NOT be interleaved. A sequence of put calls should be used to fill the page, a sequence of get calls can then be used to read from the page.

isFull

public boolean isFull()
In put mode, is the page full?

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
For get mode, have we read all the tuples?

public int getFlag()

hasTuples

public boolean hasTuples()
